feedback:
Excellent application of the DRIVER framework throughout your work. You clearly demonstrated 6 stages: D, R, I, V, E, R2.


STRENGTHS:
- Financial APP: The submission shows a working financial tool that records income/expenses, categorizes entries, and computes net income, with live examples of single and batch inputs and confirmation of successful recordings (Discover + Implement). The student's reflection confirms iterative improvement but does not undermine functionality, meeting the standards for a PASS.
- Integrate AI: The student demonstrates effective AI integration: they connected Gemini and memory to an entry tool, designed a prompt to extract structured fields, and implemented interactive handling of ambiguous inputs that updates the spreadsheet (net income). Multiple concrete examples and implementation details across Discover and Implement support a thorough, value-adding integration.

criteria.criterion_name: Financial APP: The tool functions as a financial application.
evidence: "I wanted the date, a general category, the income and expense, and then I set it to also calculate the net income."
"So I can say it was an expense to Venmo."
"So then it thinks and it goes and it says everything's successful. And over here I get a date pops up for today and Venmo an expense of 100 and our net income is here."
criteria.driver_alignment: Discover: student chose a balance sheet and specified financial fields (date, category, income/expense, net income). Implement: student demonstrates logging transactions (expense to Venmo, multiple entries) and integration with Gemini to process entries. Reflect: student notes learning curve, indicating iterative development and validation.
criteria.reasoning: The submission shows a working financial tool that records income/expenses, categorizes entries, and computes net income, with live examples of single and batch inputs and confirmation of successful recordings (Discover + Implement). The student's reflection confirms iterative improvement but does not undermine functionality, meeting the standards for a PASS.

criteria.criterion_name: Integrate AI: The tool integrates AI capabilities effectively.
evidence: "for this I hooked it up to Gemini, had a simple memory and then in the entry tool"

"So, I used Gemini to help me come up with a good prompt for the AI agent. ... responsibilities are extracting the factors of um the date, what category things go into, income, expenses, and noting that if it's not specified is automatically zero."
"If you don't give any indication whether it's an income or expense, uh, then it'll ask it."
criteria.driver_alignment:
- Discover: defined the balance sheet goal and required outputs ("I wanted the date... and then I set it to also calculate the net income"), showing intent to automate.
- Implement: connected the system to Gemini, added memory and an entry tool, and crafted a prompt to extract fields and handle ambiguityâ€”demonstrating concrete AI integration.
- Reflect: acknowledges learning curve and iterative tool choices, indicating thoughtful application and refinement.
criteria.reasoning: The student demonstrates effective AI integration: they connected Gemini and memory to an entry tool, designed a prompt to extract structured fields, and implemented interactive handling of ambiguous inputs that updates the spreadsheet (net income). Multiple concrete examples and implementation details across Discover and Implement support a thorough, value-adding integration.
